verses.verse: Woe <WH1945> unto them that decree <WH2710> unrighteous <WH205> decrees <WH2711>, and that write <WH3789> grievousness <WH5999> which they have prescribed <WH3789>; that write: or, to the writers that write grievousness

To turn aside <WH5186> the needy <WH1800> from judgment <WH1779>, and to take away <WH1497> the right <WH4941> from the poor <WH6041> of my people <WH5971>, that widows <WH490> may be their prey <WH7998>, and that they may rob <WH962> the fatherless <WH3490>!

And what will ye do <WH6213> in the day <WH3117> of visitation <WH6486>, and in the desolation <WH7722> which shall come <WH935> from far <WH4801>? to whom will ye flee <WH5127> for help <WH5833>? and where will ye leave <WH5800> your glory <WH3519>?

Without me they shall <WH1115> bow down <WH3766> under the prisoners <WH616>, and they shall fall <WH5307> under the slain <WH2026>. For all this his anger <WH639> is not turned away <WH7725>, but his hand <WH3027> is stretched out still <WH5186>.

O <WH1945> Assyrian <WH804>, the rod <WH7626> of mine anger <WH639>, and the staff <WH4294> in their hand <WH3027> is mine indignation <WH2195>. O: or, Woe to the Assyrian: Heb. Asshur and: or, though

I will send <WH7971> him against an hypocritical <WH2611> nation <WH1471>, and against the people <WH5971> of my wrath <WH5678> will I give him a charge <WH6680>, to take <WH7997> the spoil <WH7998>, and to take <WH962> the prey <WH957>, and to tread them down <WH7760> <WH4823> like the mire <WH2563> of the streets <WH2351>. tread: Heb. lay them a treading
Howbeit he meaneth <WH1819> not so, neither doth his heart <WH3824> think <WH2803> so; but it is in his heart <WH3824> to destroy <WH8045> and cut off <WH3772> nations <WH1471> not a few <WH4592>.
For he saith <WH559>, Are not my princes <WH8269> altogether <WH3162> kings <WH4428>?
Is not Calno <WH3641> as Carchemish <WH3751>? is not Hamath <WH2574> as Arpad <WH774>? is not Samaria <WH8111> as Damascus <WH1834>?
As my hand <WH3027> hath found <WH4672> the kingdoms <WH4467> of the idols <WH457>, and whose graven images <WH6456> did excel them of Jerusalem <WH3389> and of Samaria <WH8111>;
Shall I not, as I have done <WH6213> unto Samaria <WH8111> and her idols <WH457>, so do <WH6213> to Jerusalem <WH3389> and her idols <WH6091>?

Wherefore it shall come to pass, that when the Lord <WH136> hath performed <WH1214> his whole work <WH4639> upon mount <WH2022> Zion <WH6726> and on Jerusalem <WH3389>, I will punish <WH6485> the fruit <WH6529> of the stout <WH1433> heart <WH3824> of the king <WH4428> of Assyria <WH804>, and the glory <WH8597> of his high <WH7312> looks <WH5869>. punish: Heb. visit upon stout: Heb. greatness of the heart

For he saith <WH559>, By the strength <WH3581> of my hand <WH3027> I have done <WH6213> it, and by my wisdom <WH2451>; for I am prudent <WH995>: and I have removed <WH5493> the bounds <WH1367> of the people <WH5971>, and have robbed <WH8154> their treasures <WH6259> <WH6264>, and I have put down <WH3381> the inhabitants <WH3427> like a valiant <WH47> <WH3524> man: a valiant: or, many people

And my hand <WH3027> hath found <WH4672> as a nest <WH7064> the riches <WH2428> of the people <WH5971>: and as one gathereth <WH622> eggs <WH1000> that are left <WH5800>, have I gathered <WH622> all the earth <WH776>; and there was none that moved <WH5074> the wing <WH3671>, or opened <WH6475> the mouth <WH6310>, or peeped <WH6850>.

Shall the axe <WH1631> boast <WH6286> itself against him that heweth <WH2672> therewith? or shall the saw <WH4883> magnify <WH1431> itself against him that shaketh <WH5130> it? as if the rod <WH7626> should shake <WH5130> itself against them that lift it up <WH7311>, or as if the staff <WH4294> should lift up <WH7311> itself, as if it were no wood <WH6086>. the rod: or, a rod should shake them that lift it up itself, as if: or, that which is not wood

Therefore shall the Lord <WH113>, the Lord <WH136> <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635>, send <WH7971> among his fat ones <WH4924> leanness <WH7332>; and under his glory <WH3519> he shall kindle <WH3344> a burning <WH3350> like the burning of a fire <WH784>.

And the light <WH216> of Israel <WH3478> shall be for a fire <WH784>, and his Holy One <WH6918> for a flame <WH3852>: and it shall burn <WH1197> and devour <WH398> his thorns <WH7898> and his briers <WH8068> in one <WH259> day <WH3117>;

And shall consume <WH3615> the glory <WH3519> of his forest <WH3293>, and of his fruitful field <WH3759>, both soul <WH5315> and body <WH1320>: and they shall be as when a standardbearer <WH5263> fainteth <WH4549>. both: Heb. from the soul, and even to the flesh
And the rest <WH7605> of the trees <WH6086> of his forest <WH3293> shall be few <WH4557>, that a child <WH5288> may write <WH3789> them. few: Heb. number

And it shall come to pass in that day <WH3117>, that the remnant <WH7605> of Israel <WH3478>, and such as are escaped <WH6413> of the house <WH1004> of Jacob <WH3290>, shall no more again <WH3254> stay <WH8172> upon him that smote <WH5221> them; but shall stay <WH8172> upon the LORD <WH3068>, the Holy One <WH6918> of Israel <WH3478>, in truth <WH571>.
The remnant <WH7605> shall return <WH7725>, even the remnant <WH7605> of Jacob <WH3290>, unto the mighty <WH1368> God <WH410>.

For though thy people <WH5971> Israel <WH3478> be as the sand <WH2344> of the sea <WH3220>, yet a remnant <WH7605> of them shall return <WH7725>: the consumption <WH3631> decreed <WH2782> shall overflow <WH7857> with righteousness <WH6666>. of them: Heb. in, or, among, etc with: or, in
For the Lord <WH136> GOD <WH3069> of hosts <WH6635> shall make <WH6213> a consumption <WH3617>, even determined <WH2782>, in the midst <WH7130> of all the land <WH776>.

Therefore thus saith <WH559> the Lord <WH136> GOD <WH3069> of hosts <WH6635>, O my people <WH5971> that dwellest <WH3427> in Zion <WH6726>, be not afraid <WH3372> of the Assyrian <WH804>: he shall smite <WH5221> thee with a rod <WH7626>, and shall lift up <WH5375> his staff <WH4294> against thee, after the manner <WH1870> of Egypt <WH4714>. and shall: or, but he shall lift up his staff for
For yet a very <WH4213> little while <WH4592>, and the indignation <WH2195> shall cease <WH3615>, and mine anger <WH639> in their destruction <WH8399>.

And the LORD <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635> shall stir up <WH5782> a scourge <WH7752> for him according to the slaughter <WH4347> of Midian <WH4080> at the rock <WH6697> of Oreb <WH6159>: and as his rod <WH4294> was upon the sea <WH3220>, so shall he lift it up <WH5375> after the manner <WH1870> of Egypt <WH4714>.

And it shall come to pass in that day <WH3117>, that his burden <WH5448> shall be taken away <WH5493> from off thy shoulder <WH7926>, and his yoke <WH5923> from off thy neck <WH6677>, and the yoke <WH5923> shall be destroyed <WH2254> because <WH6440> of the anointing <WH8081>. be taken: Heb. remove
He is come <WH935> to Aiath <WH5857>, he is passed <WH5674> to Migron <WH4051>; at Michmash <WH4363> he hath laid up <WH6485> his carriages <WH3627>:
They are gone over <WH5674> the passage <WH4569>: they have taken up their lodging <WH4411> at Geba <WH1387>; Ramah <WH7414> is afraid <WH2729>; Gibeah <WH1390> of Saul <WH7586> is fled <WH5127>.
Lift up <WH6670> thy voice <WH6963>, O daughter <WH1323> of <WH1530> Gallim <WH1554>: cause it to be heard <WH7181> unto Laish <WH3919>, O poor <WH6041> Anathoth <WH6068>. Lift: Heb. Cry shrill with
Madmenah <WH4088> is removed <WH5074>; the inhabitants <WH3427> of Gebim <WH1374> gather themselves to flee <WH5756>.

As yet shall he remain <WH5975> at Nob <WH5011> that day <WH3117>: he shall shake <WH5130> his hand <WH3027> against the mount <WH2022> of the daughter <WH1323> <WH1004> of Zion <WH6726>, the hill <WH1389> of Jerusalem <WH3389>.

Behold, the Lord <WH113>, the LORD <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635>, shall lop <WH5586> the bough <WH6288> with terror <WH4637>: and the high ones <WH7311> of stature <WH6967> shall be hewn down <WH1438>, and the haughty <WH1364> shall be humbled <WH8213>.
And he shall cut down <WH5362> the thickets <WH5442> of the forest <WH3293> with iron <WH1270>, and Lebanon <WH3844> shall fall <WH5307> by a mighty one <WH117>. by: or, mightily
